front.title: Performance Measurement Using TWAMP Light for Segment Routing Networks

abstract.t: Segment Routing (SR) leverages the source routing paradigm. SR is applicable to both Multiprotocol Label Switching (SR-MPLS) and IPv6 (SRv6) data planes. This document describes procedure for sending and processing probe query and response messages for Performance Measurement (PM) in Segment Routing networks. The procedure uses the messages defined in RFC 5357 (Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol (TWAMP) Light) for Delay Measurement, and uses the messages defined in this document for Loss Measurement. The procedure described is applicable to SR-MPLS and SRv6 data planes and is used for both Links and end-to-end SR Paths including SR Policies.
